div1.p: Truby believes that Agramonte was an immune although there is no official documentation.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, January 21, 1948
div1.opener:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco 18, California
Jan. 21/48
Dear Colonel Hench.
div1.p:
I sent the Agramonte file back to
you Jan. 19 by Registered Mail. I did not
send it air mail because I think first
class mail by rail is much safer in
winter time. After sending it, I found
the inclosed Carroll letter in his file, so
I am sending that herewith and by air
mail. My remarks are on it and I
think it a very important letter. You should
ask Miss Agramonte if she has any of
A's old records which will prove his statements
as he said he had them in the letter to S.G.
O'Reilly I think. Of course, I know such
proof does not exist. I still think you
can find that Agramonte was listed as an
immune, probably on his personal statement.

The other papers will be sent back so as
to be in your office by the time you return from
Cuba. I find them most interesting and extremely
valuable in some things.

I prefer to make notes the way I am doing
rather than to engage a stenographer. I found
that extremely unsatisfactory on the big questionnaires
last year because we could not work long at
any one time and my hours did not fit those
AC
PR
of the Stenog. I think I explained that
to you at that time. I am very well and
capabale of writing things out. You can get
them important things typed when if you think that [unclear] would be
of assistance to you.

I hope you find old “Ranny” Kean well.
He has failed a lot in the last 5 yrs.
I saw him in 1942 and again last summer
and the change was marked although he was
keen still, mentally. Gen. Ireland was not
so good in that respect.

I find that Gen. Mc Coy was in Cuba with Gen
Wood so you should get in touch with him.
If you do, ask him if he has read my
book and see what he says. If you
go to N.Y.C. See if Hoeber is going to print
some more of those books of mine. I get many
inquires and requests for copies. I have
done nothing about it because of the high cost
of labor & materials and I feel that if I
ask it will not tend to produce results.

I know you & Mrs Hench will have
a grand time in Florida & Cuba. It is a nice
time of the year to be there. Take some of those
fine maps of Havana & Camp Columbia with you
and locate some of the fine spots we have
talked about.

closer.salute:
With sincere regards & best wishes
Cordially yours
